774808 THE PETROLEUM (BERAR EXTENSION) ACT, 1937
ACT NO. 23 OF 1937 [ 7th October, 1937.]
An Act to extend the Petroleum Act, 1934, to Berar.
WHEREAS in Berar the importation, possession and transport of petroleum and other substances are regulated by the Indian Petroleum Act, 1899 (8 of 1899), as applied to Berar by order made under the Indian (Foreign Jurisdiction) Order in Council, 1902;
1
AND WHEREAS it is expedient that the Indian Petroleum Act, 1899 (8 of 1899), in its application to Berar should be repealed and that the Petroleum Act, 1934 (30 of 1934), should be extended to Berar;
It is hereby enacted as follows:--
275532 1Short title. This Act may be called the Petroleum (Berar Extension) Act, 1937.
181262 2Repeal in Berar of Act 8 of 1899 and extension of Act 30 of 1934. The Indian Petroleum Act, 1899 (8 of 1899), as in force in Berar, is hereby repealed, and the Petroleum Act, 1934 (30 of 1934), is hereby extended to and declared to be in force in Berar.
153740 3Operation of rules. Rules made and notifications issued under the Petroleum Act, 1934 (30 of 1934), and in force in 2 Part A States and Part C States (excluding Berar)] at the commencement of this Act are hereby extended to and declared to be in force in Berar. 999999 1Second paragraph omitted by the A.
